question_text: Why might a legacy industrial controller still require a DB9 serial interface instead of modern USB?
answer_options: USB does not support low-power signaling
RS232 requires less software overhead and is easier to debug
Modern operating systems no longer recognize USB
correct_answer: RS232 requires less software overhead and is easier to debug
explanation: RS232â€™s simplicity and predictable behavior make it ideal for low-level device communication and debugging in legacy environments.
